    • Method Detail

      • getBossNames

        public static java.util.Map<org.bukkit.entity.EntityType,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getBossNames()
        Get a map of available EntityTypes and the bossnames that are available for it.
        Returns:
        the map containing all the available bossnames grouped by EntityType
        Since:
        Corruption 2.2

      • getRandomBossName

        public static java.lang.String getRandomBossName(org.bukkit.entity.EntityType entityType)
        Get a random bossName belonging to a certain entityType
        Parameters:
        entityType - The EntityType of the bossName you want
        Returns:
        a random bossName that has the supplied EntityType or null if no bossName with this EntityType exists
        Since:
        Corruption 2.2

      • addBoss

        public static Boss addBoss(org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity livingEntity)
        Make the supplied livingEntity a (random) boss of the appropriate entityType
        Parameters:
        livingEntity - The LivingEntity to make a boss of
        Returns:
        The boss object of the new boss or null if no boss with the appropriate EntityType has been defined or the LivingEntity was invalid
        Since:
        Corruption 2.2

      • addBoss

        public static Boss addBoss(org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity livingEntity,
           boolean updateEntity)
        Make the supplied livingEntity a (random) boss of the appropriate entityType
        Parameters:
        livingEntity - The LivingEntity to make a boss of
        updateEntity - Whether or not to adjust the entity with params from the BossData to force a WitherSkeleton for example
        Returns:
        The boss object of the new boss or null if no boss with the appropriate EntityType has been defined or the LivingEntity was invalid
        Since:
        Corruption 2.2

      • addBoss

        public static Boss addBoss(org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity livingEntity,
           java.lang.String bossName)
        Make the supplied livingEntity a boss of the bossName type
        Parameters:
        livingEntity - The LivingEntity to make a boss of
        bossName - The name of the boss type this livingEntity will be one of
        Returns:
        The boss object of the new boss or null if no boss with the appropriate EntityType has been defined or the LivingEntity was invalid
        Since:
        Corruption 2.2

      • addBoss

        public static Boss addBoss(org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity livingEntity,
           java.lang.String bossName,
           boolean updateEntity)
        Make the supplied livingEntity a boss of the bossName type
        Parameters:
        livingEntity - The LivingEntity to make a boss of
        bossName - The name of the boss type this livingEntity will be one of
        updateEntity - Whether or not to adjust the entity with params from the BossData to force a WitherSkeleton for example
        Returns:
        The boss object of the new boss or null if no boss with the appropriate EntityType has been defined or the LivingEntity was invalid
        Since:
        Corruption 2.2

      • spawnBoss

        public static Boss spawnBoss(org.bukkit.Location loc,
             org.bukkit.entity.EntityType entityType)
        Spawn a corrupted at a location using an EntityType.
        Parameters:
        loc - The location to spawn the boss at
        entityType - The EntityType of the new bosses
        Returns:
        The spawned boss or null if the bossName is invalid
        Since:
        Corruption 2.2

      • spawnBoss

        public static Boss spawnBoss(org.bukkit.Location loc,
             java.lang.String bossName)
        Spawn a corrupted at a location using a bossname. To see which names you can use see the getBossNames()
        Parameters:
        loc - The location to spawn the boss at
        bossName - The name of the boss
        Returns:
        The spawned boss or null if the bossName is invalid
        Since:
        Corruption 2.2

      • spawnBoss

        public static java.util.List<Boss> spawnBoss(org.bukkit.Location loc,
                             org.bukkit.entity.EntityType entityType,
                             int amount)
        Spawn a corrupted at a location using an entityType.
        Parameters:
        loc - The location to spawn the bosses at
        entityType - The EntityType of the new bosses
        amount - The amount of bosses to spawn
        Returns:
        A List of the spawned bosses or null if the bossName is invalid or no bosses were spawned
        Since:
        Corruption 2.2

      • spawnBoss

        public static java.util.List<Boss> spawnBoss(org.bukkit.Location loc,
                             java.lang.String bossName,
                             int amount)
        Spawn a certain amount of corrupted at a location using a bossname. To see which names you can use see the getBossNames()
        Parameters:
        loc - The location to spawn the bosses at
        bossName - The name of the boss
        amount - The amount of bosses to spawn
        Returns:
        A List of the spawned bosses or null if the bossName is invalid or no bosses were spawned
        Since:
        Corruption 2.2

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getHealth

        public static int getHealth(org.bukkit.entity.Entity e)
        Parameters:
        e - Entity to get the health of
        Returns:
        int The health of the boss or -1 if the entity is not a boss

      • getHealthCoef

        public static double getHealthCoef(org.bukkit.entity.Entity e)
        Parameters:
        e - Entity to get the health coefficient of
        Returns:
        double The health coefficient of the boss or -1.0 if the entity is not a boss
        See Also:
        {@link #isUsingAbsoluteHealth(Entity e)} to check if this value is a multiplier or an absolute value

      • isUsingAbsoluteHealth

        public static boolean isUsingAbsoluteHealth(org.bukkit.entity.Entity e)
        Parameters:
        e - Entity to get to check if having an absolute health
        Returns:
        True if this entity has an absolute health, false if it doesn't or the entity is not a boss

      • getMaxHealth

        public static int getMaxHealth(org.bukkit.entity.Entity e)
        Deprecated. Using livingEntity.getMaxHealth() is usually sufficient. This method was put in place when livingEntity.setMaxHealth() was not yet available.
        Parameters:
        e - Entity to get the max health of
        Returns:
        int The maximum health of the boss or entity. Will return 0 if the entity is not alive anymore

      • getName

        public static java.lang.String getName(org.bukkit.entity.Entity e)
        Parameters:
        e - Entity of the Boss you want to get the name of
        Returns:
        String The name of the boss, or an empty string when the entity is not a boss.

      • getRawName

        public static java.lang.String getRawName(org.bukkit.entity.Entity e)
        Parameters:
        e - Entity of the Boss you want to get the raw/unformatted name of
        Returns:
        String The raw/unformatted name of the boss, or an empty string when the entity is not a boss.

      • setHealth

             int health)
        Parameters:
        e - Entity to set the health of
        health - the amount of health you want the boss to have

        public static boolean isDead(org.bukkit.entity.Entity e)
        Parameters:
        e - The entity that you want to check
        Returns:
        boolean Whether the Boss is dead, when the entity is not a boss, it will return true

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        boolean Whether the Boss is dead

      • isNear

        public static boolean isNear(org.bukkit.Location first,
             org.bukkit.Location second,
             int minDistance,
             int maxDistance)
        Parameters:
        first - The first location
        second - The second location
        minDistance - The minimum distance between the locations
        maxDistance - The maximum distance between the locations
        Returns:
        boolean Whether or not the two locations match the minDistance and maxDistance

      • hasBossMetatag

        public static boolean hasBossMetatag(org.bukkit.entity.Entity e)
        Parameters:
        e - Entity to check the metadatatag isBoss of
        Returns:
        boolean Whether the entity has the isBoss metadatatag and whether or not it received it from Corruption
